description: RQ1 contains additional detail for each nonstock requisitioned item. This segment definition is paired with a preceding RQD segment.

1.name: Anticipated Price
1.description: This field contains the reference price for the requisition unit of measure that is known to the requisition application. It may or may not be the actual cost of acquiring the item from a supplier. It is also not the price charged to the patient.

2.name: Manufacturer Identifier
2.description: This field contains the unique code that identifies the manufacturer on the application receiving the requisition. This field is conditional because either RQ1-2-manufacturer ID and RQ1-3-manufacturers catalog or RQ1-4-vendor ID and RQ1-5-vendor catalog must be valued.

3.name: Manufacturer's Catalog
3.description: This field is the manufacturers catalog number or code for this item. This field is conditional because either RQ1-2-manufacturer ID and RQ1-3-manufacturers catalog or RQ1-4-vendor ID and RQ1-5-vendor catalog must be valued.

4.name: Vendor ID
4.description: This field is the unique code that identifies the vendor on the application receiving the requisition. This field is conditional because either RQ1-2-manufacturer ID and RQ1-3-manufacturers catalog or RQ1-4-vendor ID and RQ1-5-vendor catalog must be valued.

5.name: Vendor Catalog
5.description: This field is the vendors catalog number, name, or code for this item. This field is conditional because either RQ1-2-manufacturer ID and RQ1-3-manufacturers catalog or RQ1-4-vendor ID and RQ1-5-vendor catalog must be valued.

6.name: Taxable
6.description: This field indicates whether this item is subject to tax.
6.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables

7.name: Substitute Allowed
7.description: This field indicates whether the ancillary department may substitute an equivalent version of the item(s) ordered. Refer to HL7table 0136 - Yes/no indicator as defined in Chapter 2.
7.data_type: ID - Coded values for HL7 tables
